oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ab. Berakhathah
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bible
Religion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Samaritan manuscript of the Pentateuch: the first five books of the Bible: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy. The text text occupies 303 folios. The manuscript has suffered damaged at both the beginning and the end, with loss of text. The manuscript is written in black ink, script being a large majuscule. There are 26 lines to a full page and c. 23 letters to a full line. The manuscript has been bound in brown Levant morrocco (goatskin) with ornamental blind-tooling.
